repo.name: mongoose
repo.description: MongoDB object modeling designed to work in an asynchronous environment.

cves.summary: Mongoose Vulnerable to Prototype Pollution in Schema Object
Improper Input Validation in Automattic Mongoose
automattic/mongoose vulnerable to Prototype pollution via Schema.path

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation instructions with solid examples, but lacks comprehensive configuration documentation and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Missing troubleshooting section for common issues like connection failures, validation errors, or performance problems that users typically encounter.

security.summary: The provided code appears to be generally secure, but there are some potential input validation and error exposure concerns that should be addressed to ensure the security of the application.

common_complaints: TypeScript type inference issues with virtuals
Map subdocuments and cloning edge cases
Memory leaks and session handling in async operations
Schema field inclusion behavior (10-year-old unresolved issue)
praise_themes: Appreciation for maintainer's work and effort
sentiment.summary: Mongoose shows active maintenance with recent bug fixes and ongoing development, but faces technical debt around type safety, edge cases in nested documents, and some long-standing unresolved issues.

communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and helpful, showing a good level of technical depth and patience.

concerns: Zero commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-14)
No active contributors in past 6 months
195 open issues with no recent closures
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Discrepancy between recent last commit timestamp and complete lack of activity metrics suggests data inconsistency or project stasis
maintenance.summary: Mongoose appears abandoned or in complete stasis - despite a recent commit timestamp, there are zero contributions, issue resolutions, or releases over the past 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured and comprehensive, but lacks migration guides for users upgrading from previous versions.

governance.summary: The project has a documented decision process, a contributor ladder, and indicates multiple maintainers but lacks a succession plan.

suspicious_patterns.matched_content: 'https://bit.ly/mongoose-schematypes for a list of valid schema types.'
'https://mongoosejs.com/docs/guide.html#definition for more info on supported schema syntaxes.'
'https://bit.ly/mongoose-schematypes for a list of valid schema types.'

'https://mongoosejs.com/docs/guide.html#definition for more info on supported schema syntaxes.'

project_metrics.description: MongoDB object modeling designed to work in an asynchronous environment.

analysis_summary.security_summary: 7 known CVEs, has SECURITY.md, Dependabot enabled
analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to Mongoose, but could benefit from more concise language and additional troubleshooting resources.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear and comprehensive troubleshooting section
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (300)
A significant number of merged PRs in the past six months (215)
Recent last commit and release dates
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
